ai_news_elizaos_discord_md_2025-11-08.content:
# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-08

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- Users are actively migrating from AI16Z tokens to the new ELIZAOS tokens using the migration portal
- Migration ratio is 1:6 (one old token for six new tokens)
- Some exchanges (Gate.io, KuCoin) have suspended AI16Z withdrawals and trading while awaiting new tokens
- Bybit will reportedly launch ELIZAOS trading on November 12th
- Some users reported technical issues with Phantom wallet showing security warnings during migration
- The ELIZAOS token is mintable to support multichain functionality

### Platform Development
- Discussion about creating a streaming network concept that would house multiple shows including "Clank Tank"
- Proposal to develop an umbrella brand similar to television networks rather than separate accounts per show
- Ideas to repurpose "$ai16z retire code" for interactive features in streams
- Migration messaging assets being created with "go migrate now" content

### Business Strategy
- Comparison of OpenAI's business model to AWS's approach (offering services at a loss to individuals while generating revenue from enterprise customers)
- Discussion about OpenAI likely earning more from API sales and partnerships than from individual users

### Marketing & Community
- Social media promotion strategy being implemented on X (formerly Twitter)
- Team discussing how to optimize posts for algorithm visibility
- Concerns about Discord invites landing in mod-chat rather than discussion channels

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: If I wait for the gate, I can swap, right?**  
A: Yes, you can (answered by Sauve)

**Q: During migration on the phantom wallet, I had a blocked warning saying carry on with precaution. Is this safe if I used the official link?**  
A: Worked safely for me. As long as you're using the link pinned in this channel (answered by Mario)

**Q: Could somebody please answer when Gate is going to complete the migration?**  
A: "We will proceed with the token swap as soon as we receive the new tokens from the project team." (Gate.io statement shared by bct)

**Q: Why is it still showed Mintable?**  
A: Needs to be mintable to be multichain (answered by Mario)

**Q: Is this token still considered a meme coin?**  
A: No, it is AI utility. Also benefiting from memes momentum through old coin (AI16Z) (answered by Omid sa)

**Q: Can we do this from community handle also as well as cj's?**  
A: You can use that one if you want (answered by cjft)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Wallet Migration Support**
   - Mario helped maddeys with Phantom wallet issues by explaining to copy the link into the search browser in Phantom, connect wallet, and swap
   - Mario assisted Gemruda with tokens not showing in wallet by advising to select the coin to display in Phantom wallet

2. **Exchange Migration Workarounds**
   - Smokin_Dave_007 suggested users unable to withdraw from exchanges should transfer from exchange to EVM wallet and use the migration link
   - Kenk shared KuCoin announcement confirming support for the swap and noted the team would likely contact exchanges on Monday

3. **Concept Clarification**
   - Jin clarified to users that rather than having separate accounts per show, they're considering an umbrella brand to house multiple shows

## Action Items

### Technical
- Team needs to send new ELIZAOS tokens to exchanges like Gate.io and KuCoin to complete migration for users (mentioned by bct)
- Fix Discord invites to land in discussion instead of mod-chat (mentioned by Kenk)
- Migration messaging implementation with "go migrate now" content (mentioned by Kenk)

### Documentation
- Provide clearer information about the mintable status of ELIZAOS and its multichain functionality (mentioned by Seree)
- Create clear timeline for exchange migrations and communicate it to users (mentioned by kudin28)
- Compile statistics on AI16z token migration percentages, possibly via Dune Analytics (mentioned by MicoM.ron)

### Feature
- Ensure proper display of ELIZAOS tokens in wallets after migration (mentioned by Gemruda)
- Repurpose "$ai16z retire code" for interactive stream features allowing users to "retire" coins triggering audio/visual effects (mentioned by DorianD)
- Create an umbrella brand/network for multiple shows including Clank Tank (mentioned by jin)
- Develop branding for the network concept with a "slick name" for the umbrella network brand (mentioned by jin)

ai_news_elizaos_discord_md_2025-11-07.content:
# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-07

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration (AI16Z to elizaOS)
- Migration portal launched on November 6th with a 90-day window ending February 4th, 2024
- Conversion ratio: 1 AI16Z = 6 elizaOS tokens
- Migration was delayed initially due to issues with the LP provider on Base, but eventually launched successfully
- Users reported smooth migration experiences through the portal
- Some exchanges are still implementing the swap, causing temporary token disappearance from exchange wallets
- Shaw confirmed unclaimed tokens won't be burned after the deadline; users can create support tickets

### Technical Developments
- Jin implemented headless Chrome with GPU support to stream WebGL applications to RTMP endpoints
- The containerized approach enables reliable 24/7 streaming of interactive 3D simulations with live chat integration
- Plans to support multiple avatars and shows in the interactive streaming setup

### Business Developments
- Deal nearly finalized with X to recover accounts through a backdated enterprise license (expected in 1-2 weeks)
- Positive discussions with Coinbase about a potential listing, facilitated by a connection named Gaia

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: What is the ratio for the AI16Z to elizaOS swap?**  
A: 1 AI16Z = 6 elizaOS (answered by Natefrog)

**Q: When is the migration portal going live?**  
A: November 6th with a 90-day window until February 4th (answered by Burn)

**Q: What's the contract address for elizaOS?**  
A: It's available in the mirror.xyz article linked in announcements (answered by unfinished)

**Q: Do I need gas fee for token migration?**  
A: Yes, you need Solana for the migration (answered by multiple users)

**Q: Will AI16Z tokens on exchanges be automatically converted?**  
A: Yes, exchanges will handle the migration automatically (answered by Kenk)

**Q: Does it matter if I migrate now or later?**  
A: No, there's no explicit benefit to migrating early (answered by Mario)

**Q: Can I still buy AI16Z today and migrate?**  
A: Yes, you can buy AI16Z and migrate until February 4th (answered by 0xTDL ‚ö°)

**Q: Why can't I see elizaOS in my Phantom wallet after migration?**  
A: You may need to manually add the token in Phantom settings (answered by The Light)

**Q: What happens to any unclaimed ElizaOS on Feb 6th? It gets burned?**  
A: "Nah you just have to make a support ticket on Discord. Not gonna burn or mess with anyone, could cause fud" (answered by shaw)

**Q: So this lets you stream some talking avatar direct to pump?**  
A: "Or most streaming services really" (answered by Odilitime)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Phantom Wallet Token Visibility**
   - Helper: The Light
   - Issue: Multiple users couldn't see elizaOS tokens in Phantom wallet after migration
   - Resolution: Instructed to tap the 3 slider bars in Phantom browser, manage tokens, and set elizaOS to visible

2. **Phantom Wallet Connection**
   - Helper: MDMnvest
   - Issue: User couldn't find Phantom wallet to connect
   - Resolution: Advised to copy/paste the migration link in Phantom wallet for automatic connection

3. **Unstaking Transaction Errors**
   - Helper: old_visions & Odilitime
   - Issue: User getting "failed to simulate transaction" error when trying to unstake AI16Z
   - Resolution: Suggested trying on desktop instead of mobile and noted that despite error message, the transaction likely worked if tokens appear in wallet

4. **Portuguese Language Support**
   - Helper: Toni
   - Issue: Portuguese user's elizaOS disappeared from Phantom wallet
   - Resolution: Provided instructions in Portuguese to manually add the token

5. **Migration Delay Explanation**
   - Helper: shaw
   - Issue: Users confused about migration delays
   - Resolution: Explained that delays were due to LP provider issues on Base, which were eventually fixed by the Aerodrom team

## Action Items

### Technical Tasks
- Update dexscreener to properly display elizaOS token name instead of "UNKNOWN" (Mentioned by Mario)
- Complete token migration on remaining exchanges (Gate.io, Bitget, KuCoin, Bybit) (Mentioned by Eriksoon21)
- Implement cross-chain bridging between EVM chains (Enable Base/BSC/ETH <-> Base/BSC/ETH bridging) (Mentioned by gin_chan)
- Polish and push new build of headless Chrome WebGL streaming container (Mentioned by jin)
- Complete Base pool deployment fixes with Aerodrom team (Mentioned by shaw)
- Finalize deal with X to recover accounts through backdated enterprise license (Mentioned by shaw)

### Documentation Needs
- Create comprehensive guide for migration process with step-by-step instructions and screenshots (Mentioned by Multiple users)
- Publish official contract addresses for all chains as a centralized source of truth (Mentioned by JaiBo)
- Clarify exchange migration timelines with updates on when each CEX will complete migration (Mentioned by Multiple users)
- Create support ticket system for users with unclaimed tokens after migration deadline (Mentioned by shaw)
- Address confusion around framework IDs and clarify the system for creating groups and triggering agent posts (Mentioned by Amir)

### Feature Requests
- Add staking functionality for elizaOS tokens (Mentioned by imcryptor)
- Implement multiple avatars and shows in interactive 3D simulation (Mentioned by jin)
- Consider making containerized streaming an Eliza cloud feature (Mentioned by jin)
- Potential Coinbase listing following Base deployment (Mentioned by shaw)

ai_news_elizaos_discord_md_2025-11-06.content:
# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-06

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- The migration from AI16Z tokens to ElizaOS tokens was scheduled to begin but experienced delays
- Several exchanges (MEXC, Binance Alpha, Gate, and Bybit) are supporting the migration with different timelines
- MEXC appears to be the first exchange to complete the swap for users
- The migration process involves minimal gas fees and will remain open for 90 days
- Tokens will be immediately tradeable after migration
- Community members repeatedly asked about migration procedures for self-custody wallets

### Development Updates
- Shaw submitted and R0am merged PR #5 to the otc-agent repository
- Development of a "login with cloud" SDK is underway to enable seamless authentication across multiple applications
- Plans to add an "Apps" section to Cloud where users can whitelist domains and link external apps
- Discussion about plugin-sql dependencies and requests to release the plugin-elizacloud plugin
- Sentry errors were dismissed as a non-issue from a single user

### Community & Promotion
- Coordination for promotional activities including a town hall featuring "Eliza agents"
- Plans to stream promotion for an OpenSea collection called "Art Decc0s"
- Discussion about Discord bot integration with ElizaOS
- Suggestions to improve project communication strategy and marketing

## Key Questions & Answers

### Token Migration
- **Q**: How do I swap AI16Z tokens for ElizaOS on exchanges?  
  **A**: Different exchanges have their own processes; check exchange announcements

- **Q**: Is there a decentralized migration option for self-custody tokens?  
  **A**: Yes, through the migration portal that will be announced

- **Q**: Will Bybit support the migration?  
  **A**: Yes, Bybit supports migration for spot trading

- **Q**: Do we need gas fee for migration?  
  **A**: Yes, but very little

- **Q**: Does the migration support Phantom wallet?  
  **A**: Yes, Phantom will be supported

- **Q**: When will trading start for the new token?  
  **A**: Depends on the exchange; Binance should be trading 7 hours after migration

- **Q**: Will the value of tokens change after migration?  
  **A**: The value of your tokens shouldn't change

- **Q**: How long is the migration window open?  
  **A**: Window is open for 90 days

- **Q**: Will migrated tokens be tradeable right away?  
  **A**: Yes, that's right

### Development
- **Q**: Can we release the plugin-elizacloud plugin?  
  **A**: Yes, just bump the package.json version to publish it

- **Q**: Is there a problem with Sentry errors?  
  **A**: No, it's just one user spamming a CORS error from a weird browser, elizaos works fine

- **Q**: How should I deploy a Discord bot?  
  **A**: Use plugin-discord, and visit discord.com/developers/ for setting up keys

## Community Help & Collaboration

- **Toni helped AlexZ** with correct information about Bybit supporting the migration, providing a link to Bybit's announcement
- **Burn helped Mario** by explaining that Phantom wallet would be supported, gas fees would be minimal, and the migration window would be open for 90 days
- **MDMnvest helped Muslim_Man** by explaining they need to wait for the migration portal and stay tuned to announcements
- **Figure helped KarshalQ** by directing them to the migration help channel
- **Odilitime helped Figure** with Discord bot deployment, suggesting plugin-discord and directing to discord.com/developers for setting up keys
- **Shaw helped R0am** by creating PR #5 with fixes for the otc-agent repository, which R0am merged
- **cjft helped 0xbbjoker** by advising how to release plugin-elizacloud by bumping the package.json version

## Action Items

### Technical
- Implement migration portal for self-custody wallets (Mentioned by: cjft)
- Deploy liquidity pools for ElizaOS (Mentioned by: cjft, Burn)
- Create Discord bot integration with ElizaOS (Mentioned by: Figure)
- Deploy Discord bot using plugin-discord and configure keys (Mentioned by: Figure)
- Deploy Eliza on AWS (Mentioned by: Wes)
- Implement "login with cloud" SDK for cross-app authentication (Mentioned by: cjft)
- Release plugin-elizacloud plugin (Mentioned by: 0xbbjoker)
- Fix plugin-sql dependency issues (Mentioned by: 0xbbjoker)

### Documentation
- Provide clear migration instructions for different wallets (Mentioned by: Mario, Muslim_Man)
- Create resource explaining team structure and roles (Mentioned by: Broccolex, AlexZ)
- Develop non-technical explanation of token value accrual (Mentioned by: Broccolex)
- Create or share documentation about recent migration (Mentioned by: KarshalQ)
- Create new Docs site for Cloud (Mentioned by: cjft)

### Feature
- Improve project communication strategy (Mentioned by: Broccolex)
- Expand social media presence (Mentioned by: Broccolex, AlexZ)
- Add Telegram channels including Russian language support (Mentioned by: AlexZ)
- Coordinate streaming to promote Art Decc0s OpenSea collection (Mentioned by: Reneil)
- Add "Apps" section to Cloud for domain whitelisting and external app linking (Mentioned by: cjft)

categories.summary:
# Analysis of üí¨-discussion Channel

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily focused on the migration from AI16Z tokens to the new ELIZAOS tokens. Users shared experiences with the migration portal, with some reporting successful migrations while others faced issues with exchanges like Gate.io and KuCoin. These exchanges have suspended AI16Z withdrawals and trading while awaiting the new tokens from the ELIZAOS team. According to user reports, Bybit will launch ELIZAOS trading on November 12th. The migration ratio was mentioned as 1:6 (one old token for six new tokens). Some users reported technical issues with Phantom wallet showing security warnings during migration, though those using the official pinned link confirmed it worked safely. The token appears to be mintable to support multichain functionality. Beyond migration topics, users discussed market expectations and potential value growth for ELIZAOS.

## 2. FAQ
Q: If I wait for the gate, I can swap, right? (asked by BBBIGZOA) A: yes you can (answered by Sauve | Won't DM you First)
Q: During migration on the phantom wallet, i had a blocked warning saying carry on with precaution. Is this safu as i used the official link that you shared above. (asked by maddeys) A: Worked safu for me. As long as you're using the link pinned in this channel (answered by Mario)
Q: Could somebody, please, answer when Gate is going to complete the migration? (asked by kudin28) A: We will proceed with the token swap as soon as we receive the new tokens from the project team. (answered by bct sharing Gate's statement)
Q: Can the new $elizaos token be bought on an exchange yet? (asked by Sazerac) A: Unanswered
Q: Why its still showed Mintable? (asked by Seree) A: Needs to be mintable to be multichain (answered by Mario)
Q: is eliza listed on binance or no (asked by NoRayZ) A: Unanswered
Q: is this token still considered a meme coin? (asked by NoRayZ) A: No it is ai utility. Also benefiting from memes momentum's through old coin (AI16Z) (answered by Omid sa)
Q: I have a Ai16z on radium. Will I get airdrop there (asked by Anas) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Mario | Helpee: maddeys | Context: User had issues with Phantom wallet blocking migration portal | Resolution: Mario explained to copy the link into the search browser in Phantom, connect wallet, and swap
Helper: Mario | Helpee: Gemruda | Context: User mentioned tokens not showing in wallet | Resolution: Mario advised to select the coin to display in Phantom wallet
Helper: Smokin_Dave_007 | Helpee: Exchange users | Context: Users unable to withdraw from exchanges | Resolution: Suggested transferring from exchange to EVM wallet and using the migration link
Helper: Kenk | Helpee: kudin28 | Context: User concerned about exchanges not completing token swap | Resolution: Shared KuCoin announcement confirming support for the swap and noted the team would likely contact exchanges on Monday

## 4. Action Items
Type: Technical | Description: Team needs to send new ELIZAOS tokens to exchanges like Gate.io and KuCoin to complete migration for users | Mentioned By: bct
Type: Technical | Description: Team should contact Phantom wallet regarding security warnings on the migration portal | Mentioned By: maddeys
Type: Documentation | Description: Provide clearer information about the mintable status of ELIZAOS and its multichain functionality | Mentioned By: Seree
Type: Documentation | Description: Create clear timeline for exchange migrations and communicate it to users | Mentioned By: kudin28
Type: Feature | Description: Ensure proper display of ELIZAOS tokens in wallets after migration | Mentioned By: Gemruda

# Discord Chat Analysis for üí¨-coders

## 1. Summary:
The chat segment primarily discusses conceptual ideas for a streaming platform or network that would house multiple shows, including "Clank Tank." Jin proposes merging Clank Tank into a broader network concept, similar to how television networks like CNBC or Nickelodeon host multiple shows under one brand. There's mention of repurposing "$ai16z retire code" for interactive features in streams. The conversation revolves around branding considerations, with participants discussing potential names for this umbrella network. There's also a brief question about spot trading for "Elizaos on Bing X." Overall, the discussion is conceptual rather than deeply technical, focusing on product vision rather than implementation details.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Is there even a Twitter for Clank Tank yet? (asked by who) A: Unanswered
Q: Why be an unpaid employee for X, just produce your own universe? (asked by Alsara2k) A: Unanswered
Q: When will they add spot trading for Elizaos on Bing X? (asked by –Ω–∏–∫–∏—Ç–∞) A: Unanswered
Q: Is there any general ETA on this? (asked by who) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: jin | Helpee: who | Context: Confusion about the concept being discussed | Resolution: Jin clarified that rather than having separate accounts per show, they're considering an umbrella brand to house multiple shows

## 4. Action Items:
Feature: Repurpose "$ai16z retire code" for interactive stream features | Description: Allow users to "retire" coins triggering audio/visual effects in streams | Mentioned By: DorianD
Feature: Create an umbrella brand/network for multiple shows including Clank Tank | Description: Develop a network concept similar to television networks that houses multiple shows | Mentioned By: jin
Technical: Develop branding for the network concept | Description: Create a "slick name" for the umbrella network brand | Mentioned By: jin

# Analysis of ü•á-partners Discord Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. Participants primarily discussed OpenAI's business strategy, comparing it to AWS's approach of offering services at a loss to individuals while generating revenue from enterprise customers. They noted that OpenAI likely earns more from API sales and partnerships than from individual users. There was also a brief mention about AI16z token migration statistics, though no technical details were provided. The conversation was brief and lacked concrete technical implementations or problem-solving discussions.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Do we have stats on the % of ai16z supply migrated? (asked by MicoM.ron) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
No significant help interactions were observed in this chat segment.

## 4. Action Items
Documentation: Compile statistics on AI16z token migration percentages, possibly via Dune Analytics | Description: Create dashboard or documentation showing migration progress | Mentioned By: MicoM.ron

# Discord Chat Analysis for "core-devs" Channel

## 1. Summary
This chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. The conversation primarily revolves around a social media promotion strategy where user cjft posted content on X (formerly Twitter) to promote something related to tokens. Shaw suggested adding instructions for users to post and comment with wallet addresses for token collection. Kenk mentioned migration messaging assets being worked on and suggested using the community handle for promotion. There was discussion about potential algorithm impacts of the promotional post and concerns about Discord invites landing in mod-chat rather than discussion. The chat also included some casual banter and jokes between team members. Overall, this segment lacks substantial technical content or problem-solving discussions.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Can we do this from community handle also as well as cj's? (asked by Kenk) A: cjft responded with "you can use that 1 if want" (answered by cjft)
Q: Is my post flagged? (asked by cjft) A: "Maybe... My guess is nikita has maybe trained the algo to prevent posts using 'PUMP IT UP' whilst asking for contracts to go very far" (answered by Kenk)
Q: Am I forever rekt from the algorithm now? (asked by cjft) A: "Depends what you class as rekt ig... But you'll be ok agent Jesus" (answered by Kenk)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: shaw | Helpee: cjft | Context: Improving social media post for token collection | Resolution: shaw suggested adding instructions like "post the tweet, comment under this post with your wallet address"
Helper: Kenk | Helpee: cjft | Context: Concerns about post visibility | Resolution: Kenk reassured cjft that post visibility would improve the next day as it was "late US Friday"

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Migration messaging implementation | Description: Migration clips being created with "go migrate now" messaging | Mentioned By: Kenk
Feature: Discord invite configuration | Description: Fix Discord invites to land in discussion instead of mod-chat | Mentioned By: Kenk

github_summaries_week_latest_2025-11-02..content:
# elizaos/eliza Weekly Report (Nov 2 - 8, 2025)

## üöÄ Highlights
This week's activity focused on initiating new features and planning for future enhancements. Development began on core security and runtime improvements, with new pull requests opened to implement entity-level row-level security and to add an ElizaOS reference to the runtime. Concurrently, several new issues were created to guide future work, focusing on core performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as user engagement with a points and leaderboard system. The period was characterized by laying the groundwork for upcoming features rather than completing existing ones.

## üõ†Ô∏è Key Developments
While no major features were completed this period, work was initiated on two key fronts through new pull requests:

-   **Security Framework:** A new pull request, [#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107), was opened to begin the implementation of entity-level row-level security (RLS). This work is complemented by a new issue, [#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112), opened for discussion on the same topic.
-   **Runtime Enhancements:** To improve the runtime environment, work was started in [#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111) to add an ElizaOS reference, a foundational step for future runtime capabilities.

## üêõ Issues & Triage
No issues were closed this week. The focus was on opening new discussions to shape the project's direction.

-   **New & Active Issues:** Four significant new issues were opened, outlining key areas for future development:
    -   **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were started around improving the system's operational capabilities with proposals for "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)).
    -   **User Engagement & Security:** Future enhancements were proposed for user interaction via a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) and for data security with "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)).

## üí¨ Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a focus on initiating new work streams through the opening of pull requests and issues. There were no specific details in the reports regarding high-volume discussions or collaborative reviews during this period.

github_summaries_month_latest_2025-11-01.content:
# elizaos/eliza Monthly Report (November 2025)

## üöÄ Highlights
November kicked off with a dual focus on enhancing system stability and laying the groundwork for significant new capabilities. A critical bug affecting agent settings persistence was resolved, directly improving the framework's reliability. Concurrently, new development was initiated to introduce entity-level security and enhance the core runtime. The opening of several strategic issues signals a forward-looking push towards improved performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as new user engagement features.

## üõ†Ô∏è Key Developments
Work this month balanced immediate fixes with the introduction of new features.

- **Agent Stability Improvement**
  A significant bug was fixed that prevented agent settings from persisting across restarts, ensuring that runtime-generated configurations are now correctly retained. This change, made to the core runtime initialization logic, enhances the overall reliability of agent operations ([#6106](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6106)).

- **New Feature Initiatives**
  Development began on several new fronts with the opening of new pull requests:
  - **Security:** A proposal was made to implement entity-level row-level security, aiming to add more granular data access controls ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)).
  - **Runtime Enhancements:** Work started on adding an ElizaOS reference directly to the runtime, likely to streamline framework interactions ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

## üêõ Issues & Triage
Issue tracking this month was focused on defining the next wave of development priorities.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed during this period.

- **New & Active Issues:** Several key issues were opened, outlining major areas for future work:
  - **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were initiated around implementing "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)), indicating a focus on scaling the system's operational capacity.
  - **Security & User Engagement:** New issues were created for "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)), which complements the ongoing PR, and a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) to enhance user interaction.
  - According to the reports, none of the active issues have generated more than three comments, suggesting discussions are still in their early stages.

## üí¨ Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a period of focused, heads-down development. While new pull requests and issues were opened, the data does not show any high-volume discussions or specific collaborative events. The alignment between the new pull request for RLS ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)) and the corresponding new issue ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)) suggests coordinated planning around new features.

"commentCount": 1 } ], "topPRs": [ { "id": "PR_kwDOMT5cIs6vVL6j", "title": "feat: create @elizaos/react package with headless React hooks", "author": "wtfsayo", "number": 6093, "body": "## Overview This PR introduces a new **** package containing headless, reusable React hooks extracted from the client package. This enables external developers to build custom UIs for ElizaOS agents while maintaining full type safety and React Query integration. ## What's New ### Package: A standalone package providing headless React hooks with: - ‚úÖ Zero UI coupling (no toasts, navigation, or DOM dependencies) - ‚úÖ Full TypeScript support with proper type declarations - ‚úÖ TanStack React Query for caching and state management - ‚úÖ Network-aware polling that adapts to connection quality - ‚úÖ Composable lifecycle callbacks (onSuccess, onError, onMutate) ### Hooks Included (30 total) **Agents (8 hooks)** - `useAgents`, `useAgent`, `useStartAgent`, `useStopAgent` - `useAgentActions`, `useDeleteLog`, `useAgentPanels`, `useAgentsWithDetails` **Runs (2 hooks)** - `useAgentRuns`, `useAgentRunDetail` **Messaging (5 hooks)** - `useServers`, `useChannels`, `useChannelDetails`, `useChannelParticipants`, `useDeleteChannel` **Messages (3 hooks)** - `useChannelMessages` (stateful with pagination), `useDeleteChannelMessage`, `useClearChannelMessages` **Memories (6 hooks)** - `useAgentMemories`, `useDeleteMemory`, `useDeleteAllMemories`, `useUpdateMemory`, `useDeleteGroupMemory`, `useClearGroupChat` **Internal/Agent-Perspective (6 hooks)** - `useAgentInternalActions`, `useDeleteAgentInternalLog`, `useAgentInternalMemories` - `useDeleteAgentInternalMemory`, `useDeleteAllAgentInternalMemories`, `useUpdateAgentInternalMemory` ## Architecture ```tsx import { QueryClient, QueryClientProvider } from '@tanstack/react-query'; import { ElizaReactProvider, useAgents, useStartAgent } from '@elizaos/react'; const queryClient = new QueryClient(); function App() { return ( ); } function AgentList() { const { data: agents, isLoading } = useAgents(); const startAgent = useStartAgent({ onSuccess: () => toast.success('Agent started!'), }); if (isLoading) return
Loading...
; return (
{agents?.map((agent) => (

{agent.name}

))}
); } ``` ## Benefits 1. **Reusability**: External developers can build custom UIs using these hooks 2. **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript support with types from `@elizaos/api-client` 3. **Performance**: Smart polling adapts to network quality (2G ‚Üí 4G) 4. **Separation of Concerns**: UI logic stays in components, data logic in hooks 5. **Future-proof**: Ready for migration of `packages/client` to consume these hooks ## Testing - ‚úÖ Package builds successfully with TypeScript declarations - ‚úÖ All hooks properly typed with React Query v5 signatures - ‚úÖ Zero build errors or type issues - ‚úÖ Ready for integration into turbo build pipeline ## Next Steps (Future PRs) - Migrate `packages/client` to consume `@elizaos/react` - Add unit tests for hooks with mocked ElizaClient - Publish to npm for external consumption ## Files Changed - `packages/react/` - New package with provider, hooks, and documentation - Comprehensive README with installation, API reference, and examples --- **Ready for review!** üöÄ --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces a new `@elizaos/react` package with headless, type-safe React hooks and provider (plus build/docs), integrates it into the workspace, and publishes comprehensive core type declarations. > > - **New package `@elizaos/react`**: > - Headless React hooks and provider (`ElizaReactProvider`) built on `@tanstack/react-query` and `@elizaos/api-client`. > - Hooks for: agents, runs, messaging (servers/channels), messages (stateful + pagination), memories, and internal agent-perspective operations. > - Network-aware polling, composable mutation callbacks, TypeScript types, and index exports. > - Build tooling (`build.ts`, bunfig, tsconfigs), and comprehensive README. > - **Workspace integration**: > - Added to lockfile/workspace with peer/dev deps. > - **Type declarations**: > - Added/updated numerous `@elizaos/core` `.d.ts` and source maps to expose APIs/types for consumers. > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 5a290e0071637d785858567d960ab7d1d5e54456. ", "repository": "elizaos/eliza", "createdAt": "2025-11-05T15:47:36Z", "mergedAt": "2025-11-05T17:06:38Z", "additions": 819, "deletions": 2 }, { "id": "PR_kwDOMT5cIs6xVNKQ", "title": "feat: Framework for adjusting prompts to best fix model contexts", "author": "odilitime", "number": 6113, "body": "# Risks Low, new feature, uses some memory but I put configurable limit on it # Background ## What does this PR do? It add a dynamic prompt execution system ## What kind of change is this? Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality) ## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work? People may use models with lower context and get hallucination, this helps detect when the context is blown out. # Documentation changes needed? My changes require a change to the project documentation. --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces a schema-based dynamic prompt executor with validation/retries/metrics and replaces ad-hoc prompting in message flows, plus supporting types/utils and test updates. > > - **Core Runtime**: > - Add `runtime.dynamicPromptExecFromState(...)` for schema-driven prompt execution (XML/JSON parsing, UUID validation codes, retries, Handlebars state injection, token estimations). > - Track execution metrics via `modelSchemaMetrics` and `modelMetrics` with optional LRU eviction (`DYNAMIC_PROMPT_MAX_ENTRIES`) and retry policy (`VALIDATION_LEVEL`). > - Expose metrics getters/clearers; helper methods for cache/keys; minor logging adjustments. > - **Message Service**: > - Replace manual `useModel` + XML parsing with `dynamicPromptExecFromState` in: > - `shouldRespond` evaluation (small model). > - Single-shot handler (requires `thought`, `actions`). > - Multi-step decision loop and final summary. > - Improve error logging and minor flow tweaks. > - **Types/Utils**: > - Export `SchemaRow` and `State` from `types`; extend `IAgentRuntime` with `dynamicPromptExecFromState`. > - Export `upgradeDoubleToTriple` and `composeRandomUser` from `utils`. > - **Tests/Test Utils**: > - Update `message-service` tests to mock `dynamicPromptExecFromState` responses. > - Add mock implementation in test runtime; minor logger formatting changes. > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 5905b5f9ab86dd7b7d727d92060575f42a8fc707.
